stem: The following are true about H. pylori infection EXCEPT
opt1: Can cause gastric ulcers but not duodenal ulcers
opt2: Can be eradicated by ampicillin and metronidazole
opt3: There will be histological improvement after eradication therapy
disc:
The most common cause of peptic ulcer disease (gastric and duodenal) is H. pylori. Duodenal ulcers are more associated with H. pylori compared to gastric ulcers.

Treatment of H. pylori includes a PPI and two antibiotics. Amoxicillin and clarithromycin are preferred. If no response, metronidazole, levofloxacin, or tetracycline can be considered. Bismuth can be added after changing an antibiotic (quadruple therapy).

Breath test or stool antigen should be repeated to confirm eradication.
